c74object.name: el.sarec~
c74object.description:
el.sarec~ implements sample-accurate recording, including precision punching and overdubs. The record mode is set with various messages. Recording operations are triggered exclusively by clicks with particular values. The click codes are:
1, 2, 3 ... : start recording immediately on the specified channel only. Channels are counted starting from 1.
-1 : start recording immediately on all armed channels
-2 : stop recording immediately

objarg.name: channel count
objarg.description: The number of channels in the buffer.

method.name: arm
method.description: The channel given as an argument is armed for recording. Channels are counted starting at 1. If the channel number is -1, all channels are armed. If the channel number is 0, all channels are disarmed. All channels initially armed by default.

method.name: disarm
method.description: The channel given as an argument is disarmed for recording.

method.name: overdub
method.description: Set recording mode to overdub. In this setting, recording will add to existing sound in the buffer rather than erasing it. Overdub only affects the portion of the buffer in the current region. Any other buffer contents will remain untouched.

method.name: punch
method.description: Set recording mode to punch. In this setting, recording will add to existing sound in the buffer, but with an enveloped fadein and fadeout. Punch only affects the portion of the buffer in the current region. Any other buffer contents will remain untouched.

method.name: punchfade
method.description: Set the fadein/fadeout time for the punch envelope. It is 50 ms. by default.

method.name: record
method.description: Set recording mode to record. In this setting, recording will add to write over any contents in the buffer. Record only affects the portion of the buffer in the current region. Any other buffer contents will remain untouched.

method.name: region
method.description: A region is specified in terms of start point and end point in milliseconds. Once defined, recording will only take place within that region. Recording commences immediately at the region's start point. If both start and end are set to 0, the region is set to the entire buffer. By default the entire buffer is the region.

method.name: regionsamps
method.description: A region is specified in terms of start point and end point in samples. Once defined, recording will only take place within that region. Recording operations commence immediately at the region's start point.
